definition: to protrude/to stick out/to pout (also written 噘)/to embarrass (people)
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc

sentences.english: You may dig a hole with a spade over there.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用铲正在正在边撅个坑。

sentences.english: Tell that child to stop pouting.
sentences.chinese: 叫那孩子别撅着嘴撒娇。

sentences.english: They mince and prim and pout.
sentences.chinese: 她们矫揉造作，一本正经还撅着嘴。

sentences.english: Her delicate face flushed pink, her lips pouted softly, as if she were going to cry.
sentences.chinese: 她的脸激动的发红，轻轻地撅着嘴，仿佛要哭似的。

sentences.english: Her Cupid-bow mouth pouted to give him an airy kiss.
sentences.chinese: 她那丘比特型的嘴一撅，像是要给他送一个飞吻。

sentences.english: At twenty-two I am utterly worn out and finished.
sentences.chinese: 二十二岁，我已经绝对是一撅不振，完蛋了。

sentences.english: Anthony wheedled. He badgered. He pouted. "Where would you get them?"
sentences.chinese: 安东尼开始花言巧语，继而纠缠不休，最后撅起了嘴。

sentences.english: The boys broke the sticks easily in their hands.
sentences.chinese: 四个小伙子用手轻轻一撅，树枝就断了。

sentences.english: Exhume the light from its watery grave to receive the gift of heaven.
sentences.chinese: 光从水坟中撅出来，接受上天的礼物。

sentences.english: The spoilt child sat there pouting.
sentences.chinese: 那个娇惯坏了的孩子坐在那里撅嘴。

sentences.english: The guard’s lip curled with disgust.
The guard’s lip curled with disgust.
Some species may not be able to sustain the pressure from such prevalent raids.
sentences.chinese: 一些物种无法承受这种猖撅的偷猎行为带来的压力。

sentences.english: On the rebels' banners were the words Zhang Jue the Lord of Heaven written large.
sentences.chinese: 在叛军的旗帜被这个词张撅耶和华天上的书面大。

sentences.english: She pouted and looked at him coyly.
sentences.chinese: 她撅着嘴害羞地看着他。

definition: to pout (to express anger or displeasure)
to stick up/to rise on one end/to tilt
to put one's hands on one's hips
to throw/to cast/left-slanting downward brush stroke (calligraphy)
to turn/to twist/to wring/to sprain/to swing one's hips
erhua variant of 使勁|使劲[shi3 jin4]
